did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.unittitle: Interviews in Collective Bargaining in Sports Project Audiorecordings, 1976
did.repository: Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Interviews conducted by ILR student Mike Brizel in 1976 for the Collective Bargaining in Sports project.

bioghist.head: BIOGRAPHICAL NOTE
bioghist.p: Professor Emily Clark Brown (Ph.D., University of Chicago, 1923) was an associate industrial economist, U.S. Women's Bureau, 1929, assistant professor of economics at Wellesley and assistant professor, later professor, of economics at Vassar College, beginning in 1932. Brown was a specialist in labor economics and wrote on collective bargaining, national labor policy and labor in the Soviet Union.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Interviews conducted by ILR student Mike Brizel in 1976 for the Collective Bargaining in Sports project.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions:
accessrestrict.p: Access to the collections in the Kheel Center is restricted. Please contact a reference archivist for access to these materials.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use:
userestrict.p: This collection must be used in keeping with the Kheel Center Information Sheet and Procedures for Document Use.
